APA Format — apa
text: function formats decimals leading zeroes creating reports scientific style.

title: APA Format — apa
APA Format — apa
text: value set numeric values, either single number, vector, set columns. decimals number decimal points desired output. leading Logical value: TRUE leading zeroes decimals FALSE leading zeroes decimals. default TRUE.

title: APA Format — apa
text: function creates "pretty" character vectors numeric variables   printing part report. value can take single number,   matrix, vector, multiple columns data frame, long   numeric. values coerced numeric characters   logical values, process may result error values   truly alphabetical.

title: APA Format — apa

what: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: function displays d two subjects groups gives central non-central confidence interval using pooled standard deviation denominator.

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
code: calculate_d(   m1 = NULL,   m2 = NULL,   sd1 = NULL,   sd2 = NULL,   n1 = NULL,   n2 = NULL,   t = NULL,   model = NULL,   df = NULL,   x_col = NULL,   y_col = NULL,   d = NULL,   a = 0.05,   lower = TRUE )

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: m1 mean group one m2 mean group two sd1 standard deviation group one sd2 standard deviation group two n1 sample size group one n2 sample size group two t optional, calculate d independent t, must include n1 n2 degrees freedom model optional, calculate d t.test independent t, must still include n1 n2 df optional dataframe includes x_col y_col x_col name column contains factor levels numeric vector group 1 scores y_col name column contains dependent score numeric vector group 2 scores d previously calculated d value study significance level lower Use indicate want lower upper bound d one sided confidence intervals. d positive, generally want lower = TRUE, negative d values enter lower = FALSE upper bound closer zero.

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: Provides effect size (Cohen's *d*) associated central non-central confidence intervals, *t*-statistic, confidence intervals associated means group, well standard deviations standard errors means group. one-tailed confidence interval also included sensitivity analyses. d effect size dlow noncentral lower level confidence interval d value dhigh noncentral upper level confidence interval d value dlow_central central lower level confidence interval d value dhigh_central central upper level confidence interval d value done_low noncentral lower bound one tailed confidence interval done_low_central central lower bound one tailed confidence interval M1 mean group one sd1 standard deviation group one mean se1 standard error group one mean M1low lower level confidence interval group one mean M1high upper level confidence interval group one mean M2 mean group two sd2 standard deviation group two mean se2 standard error group two mean M2low lower level confidence interval group two mean M2high upper level confidence interval group two mean spooled pooled standard deviation sepooled pooled standard error n1 sample size group one n2 sample size group two df degrees freedom (n1 - 1 + n2 - 1) t t-statistic p p-value estimate d statistic confidence interval APA style markdown printing statistic t-statistic APA style markdown printing

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: calculate \(d_s\), mean two subtracted mean one divided pooled standard deviation. $$d_s = \frac{M_1 - M_2}{S_{pooled}}$$ provide one combination following: 1: m1 n2 2: t, n1, n2 3: model, n1, n2 4: df, "x_col", "y_col" 5: x_col, y_col numeric vectors 6: d, n1, n2 must provide alpha lower ensure right confidence interval provided .

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d

what: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
title: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
text: function calculates number needed treat continuous measures (Cohen's d) using Kraemer Kupfer (2006) formula.

title: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
text: d effect size

title: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
text: Kraemer H.C., Kupfer D.J. (2006) Size treatment effects importance clinical research practice. Biolological Psychiatry, 59, 990–996. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.biopsych.2005.09.014

title: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt

what: Convert other statistics to d — other_to_d
title: Convert other statistics to d — other_to_d
text: function allows convert effect sizes d including f, f squared, number needed treat, correlation coefficient, probability superiority, proportion overlap (u1, u2, u3, proportion distribution overlap). Please note approximations.

title: Convert other statistics to d — other_to_d
code: other_to_d(   f = NULL,   f2 = NULL,   nnt = NULL,   r = NULL,   prob = NULL,   prop_u1 = NULL,   prop_u2 = NULL,   prop_u3 = NULL,   prop_overlap = NULL )

title: Convert other statistics to d — other_to_d
text: f Cohen's f f2 Cohen's f squared nnt Number needed treat r Correlation coefficient prob Probability superiority prop_u1 Proportion Overlap U1 prop_u2 Proportion Overlap U2 prop_u3 Proportion Overlap U3 prop_overlap Proportion Overlap Distributions

title: Convert other statistics to d — other_to_d
text: d

title: Convert other statistics to d — other_to_d
Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: function calculates probability superiority independent samples Cohen's d calculation.

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
code: probability_superiority(   d = NULL,   m1 = NULL,   m2 = NULL,   sd1 = NULL,   sd2 = NULL,   n1 = NULL,   n2 = NULL,   a = 0.05,   t = NULL,   model = NULL,   df = NULL,   x_col = NULL,   y_col = NULL )

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: d effect size m1 mean group one m2 mean group two sd1 standard deviation group one sd2 standard deviation group two n1 sample size group one n2 sample size group two significance level t optional, calculate d independent t, must include n1 n2 degrees freedom model optional, calculate d t.test independent t, must still include n1 n2 df optional dataframe includes x_col y_col x_col name column contains factor levels numeric vector group 1 scores y_col name column contains dependent score numeric vector group 2 scores

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: probability superiority.

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: provide one combination following: 1: d 2: m1 n2 3: t, n1, n2 4: model, n1, n2 5: df, "x_col", "y_col" 6: x_col, y_col numeric vectors

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority

what: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
text: function calculates proportion overlap two independent group d effect size calculations. Cohen's u1, u2, u3 proportion overlap provided.

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
code: proportion_overlap(   model = NULL,   x_col = NULL,   y_col = NULL,   df = NULL,   d = NULL )

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
text: model saved independent t-test model x_col name column contains factor levels numeric vector group 1 scores y_col name column contains dependent score numeric vector group 2 scores df optional dataframe includes x_col y_col d previously calculated d value

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
text: list following: u1 Proportion non-overlap across distributions u2 Proportion one group proportion group u3 Proportion one group smaller median group p_o Proportional overlap distributions

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap

what: Visualization for Estimating c Bias + Estimates — visualize_c_map
title: Visualization for Estimating c Bias + Estimates — visualize_c_map
text: function displays visualization possible bias c allows non-zero effect sensitivity. function includes ability add values effect size correlation see map onto proposed c value.

title: Visualization for Estimating c Bias + Estimates — visualize_c_map
code: visualize_c_map(   dlow,   r_values,   d_values = NULL,   f_values = NULL,   f2_values = NULL,   nnt_values = NULL,   prob_values = NULL,   prop_u1_values = NULL,   prop_u2_values = NULL,   prop_u3_values = NULL,   prop_overlap_values = NULL,   lower = TRUE )

title: Visualization for Estimating c Bias + Estimates — visualize_c_map
text: dlow lower limit possible effect size (required). r_values vector correlation values possible (required). d_values vector effect size values possible. f_values vector f effect size values possible. f2_values vector f2 effect size values possible. nnt_values vector number needed treat effect size values possible. prob_values vector probability superiority effect size values possible. prop_u1_values vector proportion overlap u1 effect size values possible. prop_u2_values vector proportion overlap u2 effect size values possible. prop_u3_values vector proportion overlap u3 effect size values possible. prop_overlap_values vector proportion distribution overlap effect size values possible. lower Use indicate want lower upper bound d one sided confidence intervals. d positive, generally want lower = TRUE, negative d values enter lower = FALSE upper bound closer zero (required).

title: Visualization for Estimating c Bias + Estimates — visualize_c_map
text: Returns pretty graph possible effect size correlation combinations region effect colored . Note effect sizes converted d graph. graph graph possible values c

title: Visualization for Estimating c Bias + Estimates — visualize_c_map
code: visualize_c_map(dlow = .25,   d_values = c(.2, .3, .8),   r_values = c(.1, .4, .3),   lower = TRUE) #> $graph  #>
